result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:26 PM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brady James Peterka in court. Court as to status of counsel. Sheriff's Office advises bond was posted on 6/2/2022.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia. No licensed liquor establishments.

1:42 PM Defendant Brady James Peterka appeared by videoin custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty. Heather Dvoran, appearing as friend of the Court.  Attorney Adam Gerol in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for the PD, will retain counsel. Defendant advised of complaint penalties thereof. Court finds probable cause. State recommends $25,000 cash bail. Court orders $20,000.00 cash bail w/conditions. Court finds good cause for not scheduling a preliminary hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
